metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1081 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
WebKit, as used in Apple Safari before 6.2.4, 7.x before 7.1.4, and 8.xbefore 8.0.4, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause adenial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via a craftedweb site, a different vulnerability than other CVEs listed inAPPLE-SA-2015-03-17-1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1081` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.10-0ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
